## Solutions {-}

#### Exercise 1. {-} 

The integral 
$$
\int_3^{10} \int_1^7 \sin(x-y) dxdy
$$
can be written as 
$$
\mathbb{E}\left(h( (X,Y) )\right),
$$
with $X$ and $Y$ being two independent uniformly distributed random variables
$$
X\sim\mathcal{U}[3,10]
$$ 
$$
Y\sim\mathcal{U}[1,7],
$$ 
and where 
$$
h(x,y) = \sin(x-y).
$$
Thus, we can write 
$$
\int_3^{10} \int_1^7 \sin(x-y) dxdy 
&= \mathbb{E}\left(h( Z )\right)\\
&= \int_3^{10} \int_1^7 \sin(x-y) f_{(X,Y)}(x,y) dx dy,
$$
where 
$$
f_{(X,Y)}(x,y) = \frac{1}{(10-3)(7-1)} = \frac{1}{42}
$$
for all $(x,y)\in[3,10]\times[1,7]$ and zero else.
